medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began approximately 6 hours prior to presentation, located in the right upper quadrant/epigastric area. It is sharp, radiating to the back, of moderate to severe intensity, and associated with nausea and vomiting. No exacerbating or relieving factors were noted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HIV infection, symptomatic cholelithiasis, vertigo, gout, mild Parkinson's disease, hypertension, hypertriglyceridemia. Past surgical history includes bilateral inguinal hernias and septorhinoplasty.
